page.title: 18EDUCATION IN SPENNITHORNE
page.content: THE PRIMARY SCHOOL FOR THIS AREA IS SPENNITHORNE C.E. PRIMARY SCHOOL.IT IS AN OLD BUILDING. IT WAS BUILT IN 1833 AND HASN'T CHANGED MUCH APART FROM THE ADDITION OF A CANTEEN, A PORTOKABIN AND NEW STORAGE HEATERS INSTEAD OF COKE STOVES.(FIVE YEARS AGO) AT THE AGE OF 11 THE PUPILS LEAVE SPENNITHORNE SCHOOL AND GO UP TO THE WENSLEYDALE SCHOOL AT LEYBURN. SOME GO TO THE RICHMOND SCHOOL 9 MILES AWAY. THE WENSLEYDALE SCHOOL IS A VERY MODERN BUILDING.MANY YOUNG PEOPLE GO ON TO COLLEGE OR UNIVERSITY TO FINISH THEIR EDUCATION. UNFORTUNATELY JOB PROSPECTS ARE VERY POOR AT THE MOMENT.THERE IS NOT VERY MUCH INDUSTRY AND FARMERS DON'T EMPLOY AS MANY PEOPLE AS THEY USED TO. SOME PEOPLE FIND WORK AT CATTERICK GARRISON EIGHT MILES AWAY.
